sen.j: 千花（ちはな）（祇園 板前割烹「千花」）は、永田基男（1923年生まれ）が昭和21年に創業した京料理の店
sen.e: Chihana (Gion chef-kappo, "Chihana") is a Kyoto cuisine restaurant started by Motoo NAGATA (born in 1923) in 1946.
Chihana (Gion chef-kappo, "Chihana") is a Kyoto restaurant started by Motoo NAGATA (born in 1923) in 1946.
Chihana (Gion chef-kappo, 'Chihana') is a Kyoto restaurant started by Motoo NAGATA (born in 1923) in 1946.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 白洲次郎・正子をはじめ数多くの文化人が来店した店として知られ、1970年代には、フランスの料理人ポール・ボキューズが訪れ、ヌーヴェル・キュイジーヌに多大な影響を与えたといわれている。
sen.e: It is known as the restaurant that a lot of cultural figures visited including Jiro and Masako SHIRASU, and it is said that Paul Bocuse, a French Chef, visited there in 1970s and this experience influenced Nouvelle Cuisine significantly.

It is known as a restaurant which was visited by many cultural figures including Jiro and Masako SHIRASU, and it is said that Paul Bocuse, a French Chef, visited there in 1970s and this experience influenced Nouvelle Cuisine significantly.

It is known as a restaurant which was visited by many cultural figures including Jiro and Masako SHIRASU, and it is said that Paul BOCUSE, a French Chef, visited there in 1970s and this experience influenced Nouvelle Cuisine significantly.

sen.j: 食材、腕、器のすべてが一級品といわれており、今もこの店には東京のフランス料理店の人たちがわざわざ食べに来るといわれている。
sen.e: Chihana uses only the first class ingredients, bowls, and dishes, and people of French restaurants in Tokyo still come all the way to Chihana to eat.
Chihana uses only first class ingredients, bowls, and dishes, and people who run French restaurants in Tokyo still come all the way to eat at Chihana's,
Chihana uses only first class ingredients, bowls, and dishes, and people who run French restaurants in Tokyo still come all the way to eat at Chihana's.
sen.cmt: カンマ→ピリオドに修正

sen.j: また、器は、青磁白磁はもちろん有田焼、尾形乾山、清水六兵衛などの美術品クラスのものを使う。
sen.e: It uses dishes which are classified as art objects not only celadon and white porcelains but also Arita ware, Ogata-Kanzan, and Shimizu-Rokubei.
It uses dishes which are classified as art objects, which includes not only celadon and white porcelains but also Arita ware, Ogata-Kanzan, and Shimizu-Rokubei.
It uses dishes which are classified as art objects, which includes not only celadon and white porcelains but also Arita ware, Ogata-Kenzan, and Shimizu-Rokubei.

sen.j: 店は、四条通りから奥まった細い路地の奥にあり、1階は、8席ほどのカウンターとテーブルがひとつあるだけで、2階は座敷になっている。
sen.e: Located at the back of a narrow alley set back from Shijo street, the restaurant has eight sheets at the counter and a table on the first floor, and a Japanese style room with tatami mats on the second floor.

Located at the back of a narrow alley set back from Shijo street, the restaurant has eight sheets at the counter and a table on the first floor, and a Japanese style room with tatami mats on the second floor.

Located at the back of a narrow alley set back from Shijo-dori Street, the restaurant has eight sheets at the counter and a table on the first floor, and a Japanese style room with tatami mats on the second floor.

sen.j: 住所 京都府京都市東山区四条通繩手東入ル南側（祇園町南側584-13-2）

sen.j: お椀のお出汁ふたを取ったときの香りと、透明感溢れた出汁で有名で、ポール・ボキューズのスープ V.G.E.のアイデアはこの椀からといわれている。
sen.e: The aroma of the broth coming out of the bowl when the cover is lifted and its very clear soup are well known: it is said that the V.G.E. soup produced by Paul Bocuse was inspired by this soup.
The aroma of the broth coming out of the bowl when the cover is lifted and its very clear soup are well known: it is said that the V.G.E. soup produced by Paul Bocuse was inspired by this soup.
